attributes.action: Ban commerical and scientific whaling at the International Whaling Commitee in May
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Japanese Government’s whaling fleet is on the seas now, targeting 935 minke whales and 10 endangered fin whales. Most of whale populations remain depleted, some to the point of extinction. 

Loopholes in the IWC convention allow commercial whaling to continue. Under IWC rules, any member country can object an IWC decision within 90 days, and be exempt from that decision. Norway and Iceland objected. 

Japan found a loophole that allows countries to kill whales for “scientific research” The IWC requested that Japan stop this “research,” but rules allow Japan to ignore them. Meat from this “research” is packaged and sold on the market.

A recent poll shows 95% of  Japanese people have never/rarely eat whale meat, there is more than 5,000 tons in cold storage, unsold/unwanted. 69% of Japanese people don’t support whaling.

We need to stop this.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
